A structured short-term plan, utilizing instruments like corporate bonds, protects cash flows, limits behavioural mistakes, and provides the necessary breathing room for sustained investment growth.

items.summary: Banks entering acquisition financing, overseas loans getting easier and other recent RBI enablers are converging to fuel credit competition in India. Where would this leave private credit? In a position to shake off its high-risk, high-cost image and shine through.

items.title: Ghost malls rise across India as ageing centres falter; repurposing emerges as solution
items.summary: Nearly one-fifth of India's shopping centers have become 'ghost malls' due to high vacancies and outdated assets.  A significant portion of this dormant space, however, holds potential for reinvigoration, offering substantial annual rental revenue.  This highlights a growing gap between top-performing and legacy malls, necessitating strategic interventions for future retail growth.

items.summary: Namma Yatri becomes technology partner for Bharat Taxi, a cooperative alternative to ride-hailing giants Uber and Ola. The collaboration emphasizes driver benefits and zero-commission structure and marks Namma Yatri's push into north India after successful operations in the south.

items.title: IndiGo’s disruptions could hit their fiscal numbers hard: Nidhi Dhruv
items.summary: IndiGo faces short-term headwinds due to operational disruptions and regulatory scrutiny, impacting its current fiscal year's performance. Moody's downgraded its human capital score, citing leadership concerns and pilot bargaining power, though the airline's long-term Baa3 rating remains stable due to its market dominance and India's aviation growth.

items.title: Adventure deposits: A win-win-win proposition for India’s banking industry as interest rates decline
items.summary: In an environment of low interest rates that reward borrowers and punish savers, perhaps banks should be allowed to innovate. Depositors lured by capital markets may be ready to put money in ‘adventure deposits’ that offer higher returns for bearing some risk. It could be a triple-win.

items.summary: Gold Rate Today: Here are the December 9 gold prices for key cities, including Ahmedabad, Delhi, Kolkata, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru, and Chennai. Gold prices traded flat on 9th December

items.title: HSBC on IndiGo: No structural damage, no de-rating. Here's all you need to know
items.summary: IndiGo’s worst operational meltdown led to thousands of cancellations, rising costs and reputational strain, but HSBC says the airline’s long-term fundamentals remain intact. The brokerage cut its target price but kept a ‘Buy’ rating, arguing that despite new pilot-duty rules and short-term disruptions, IndiGo’s cost advantage and market position are unchanged as operations begin to stabilise.

items.title: India's aviation sector faces turbulence from fuel spike and weak rupee: JP Morgan
items.summary: India's aviation sector sees demand picking up. However, rising jet fuel prices and a weaker rupee are creating challenges.  These cost increases could affect airline profits in the coming months.  While domestic airfares are stable, international fares have seen a significant jump.  Airlines are expanding capacity, but cost pressures remain a concern for profitability.

items.title: Chinese officials call for more REITs to steady property sector
items.summary: China's securities watchdog is urging the rapid expansion of the public REIT market, advocating for commercial properties like hotels and offices to be listed soon. This move aims to ease developer liquidity pressures and meet investor demand for yield amid a sluggish property market.

items.title: Leading Indian companies collaborate with Sweden's innovators to drive decarbonisation in steel, cement sectors
items.summary: Leading Indian firms like Tata Steel are partnering with Swedish tech firms. Seven projects are set to boost decarbonisation in India's steel and cement industries. These initiatives aim to support India's 2070 net-zero goal. Projects include hydrogen use in steelmaking and green cement production. This collaboration involves top Indian companies, research institutes, and Swedish technology leaders.

items.title: Danube to invest Rs 3,500 cr to build commercial tower in Dubai, named after Shah Rukh Khan
items.summary: Dubai's Danube Properties is investing Rs 3,500 crore in a 55-storey commercial tower named after Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan. Launched last month, the project has seen an overwhelming response, with sales expected to exceed Rs 4,000 crore. This landmark development aims to address the strong demand for Grade A office space from global corporations in Dubai.

items.title: Global pilots warn India's rest rule exemption for IndiGo raises safety concerns
items.summary: The decision to grant the exemption to the rest rules is concerning because it is not based on scientific evidence, says Captain Ron Hay, president of the Montreal-based International Federation of Air Line Pilots’ Associations

items.title: Ford to use Renault technology, plants for cheaper European EVs to fend off Chinese rivals
items.summary: Renault and Ford have formed a major partnership to jointly develop small, low-cost electric vehicles and commercial vans for the European market, aiming to cut costs and counter growing competition from Chinese automakers. The first jointly developed small EV—built at a Renault plant in northern France—is expected to hit European showrooms in 2028, filling a key gap in Ford’s lineup.

items.title: US Fed meeting outcome this week: How could it impact the Indian stock market? Explained
items.summary: According to Akshat Garg, Head - Research &amp; Product at Choice Wealth, with the Fed widely expected to deliver a small cut amid a divided committee, the real market driver will be Powell’s message on inflation and growth rather than the rate move itself.

items.title: 8th pay commission: Govt shares major update in Lok Sabha. Here's what’s next for employees and pensioners
items.summary: The government has confirmed that over 50.14 lakh Central employees and 69 lakh pensioners will fall under the 8th Central Pay Commission (CPC), though the timing of its implementation and funding will be decided later. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary informed Parliament that the 8th CPC has already been constituted, with its Terms of Reference notified on November 3, 2025.

items.title: India home prices to rise at steady 6% pace but luxury sector may lose steam
items.summary: Indian home prices are projected to rise by approximately 6% over the next two years, though the luxury housing boom driving the market is expected to fade within five years. While economic growth is strong, its benefits are unevenly distributed, impacting affordability. Analysts are divided on whether first-time buyer affordability will improve or worsen in the coming year.

items.title: Nuvama Wealth fixes December 26 record date for first-ever stock split
items.summary: Nuvama Wealth Management will execute a 1:5 stock split on December 26, 2025, after shareholder approval. Each ₹10 share will be split into five ₹2 shares, with no change in total investment value for shareholders.

items.title: Govt clears two fund managers to roll out  ₹1 trillion deep-tech RDI scheme
items.summary: The first tranche of startup applications under the RDI scheme is expected by March 2026, following approvals for Birac and TDB and the near-finalization of Sidbi and SBI-AIF as fund managers.

items.title: Reddit down for second day in a row, reports on Downdetector show
items.summary: Social networking platform Reddit was reported to be down for second day in a row on 9 December, according to multiple user reports on Downdetector.

items.title: IndiGo restores full network, operations stabilise with 91% on time performance
items.summary: IndiGo has stabilized its operations, running over 1,800 flights daily with 91% on-time performance after recent disruptions. The airline has processed Rs 827 crore in refunds and assisted thousands of stranded passengers with accommodation and transport. Network coverage is fully restored, and IndiGo is working to resolve remaining issues.

items.title: Multibagger defence stock inks MoU with Telangana Govt for  ₹1,500 crore capex expansion

items.title: IndiGo crisis: Global pilots warn India's rest rule exemption for IndiGo raises safety concerns
items.summary: India's aviation regulator granted IndiGo an exemption on pilot rest rules. This decision faces criticism from the global pilot union. The union head warns that fatigue impacts safety. IndiGo faced thousands of flight cancellations due to planning issues. This exemption could worsen pilot staffing problems. Other countries also see similar challenges with pilot rest regulations.

items.title: Ed Yardeni expects 25 basis point Fed rate cut this week
items.summary: Economist Ed Yardeni anticipates ongoing US trade tensions under President Trump, viewing tariffs as a negotiation tool. He notes the US economy's resilience with strong GDP growth despite a weak labor market. Yardeni also expects a 25 basis point Fed rate cut, with the market watching for dovish or hawkish signals.

items.summary: The letter comes amid reports of a likely hostile takeover of Warner Bros by Paramount Skydance Corp, just days after the company agreed to a deal with Netflix Inc.

They contend the proposal revives a rejected technical methodology and unfairly penalizes broadcasters by excluding legitimate first exposure viewership.

items.title: India bonds steady; mood tepid on RBI's picks for bond buy
items.summary: Indian government bonds found stability Tuesday after a sharp decline, following the central bank's decision to exclude the key 10-year benchmark from its bond purchases. This move, coupled with market sentiment that the RBI's rate easing cycle is nearing its end, has led to increased yields. Traders are also watching the U.S. Federal Reserve's upcoming policy announcement.

items.title: Swiggy’s Rs 10,000 crore QIP kicks off after shareholders clear fundraise. Here's all you need to know
items.summary: Swiggy opened its Rs 10,000-crore QIP on Tuesday, a day after shareholders cleared the plan with 99.47% approval. The fundraise—its first since the 2024 IPO—comes as the company boosts spending in quick commerce to rival Blinkit and Zepto while strengthening its balance sheet.

items.title: Kaynes Technology shares rebound 14% after crashing 30% in 4 days. Should you get in or get out now?
items.summary: Kaynes Technology rebounded 14% on Tuesday after a 30% drop in four days, raising the question: buy, sell, or hold? The sell-off followed a Kotak report flagging disclosure gaps, but the company says issues are resolved. Analysts see value, with JPMorgan assigning a fair value of Rs 4,900, citing stable fundamentals and improving working capital.

items.title: Wall Street shrugs off predictions of a dovish turn at the Fed

With inflation elevated, prior rate cuts largely priced in, and fiscal expansion limiting flexibility, aggressive policy shifts look unlikely. A split FOMC with hawkish voters further reduces the scope for deeper monetary accommodation.

items.title: Consumption, banking stocks offer best value amid market weakness: Sameer Dalal

Dalal also finds Sammaan Capital compelling despite regulatory concerns, while maintaining his long-held caution on the aviation sector.

items.title: Nifty 50 slips below key support of 25,800 on weekly F&O expiry day. Will stock market bounce back from here?

items.title: Berkshire reshuffles top ranks as Greg Abel prepares to succeed Warren Buffett

Key investment manager Todd Combs is departing for JPMorgan Chase, while Marc Hamburg, the veteran finance chief, will retire in 2027, with Charles Chang set to take over. These changes signal a new era for Berkshire's leadership and investment strategy.

items.title: IndiGo Crisis: DGCA asks India's largest airline to cut flights by 5%
items.summary: IndiGo Crisis: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has mandated IndiGo to reduce its flights by 5% following a significant disruption that led to over 5,000 cancellations. IndiGo will submit a revised schedule by evening, while other airlines like Air India are asked to increase capacity. Airfare has also been capped by the regulator.

items.title: IndiGo flight status today: Check cancellations and updates from major airports
items.summary: IndiGo Flight Cancellation Today: IndiGo continued flight disruptions for the eighth day on December 9, 2025, with 58 cancellations at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. While operations are improving, over 4,500 IndiGo flights have been cancelled since December 2, with the airline expecting normalcy by December 10.

items.title: Amid IndiGo fiasco and flight cancellations, Civil Aviation Secretary says 'things almost back to normal'
items.summary: IndiGo flights cancelled: India's largest airline, IndiGo, faced a week of chaos due to massive flight cancellations, grounding tens of thousands of passengers. The government has cut IndiGo's winter schedule and reallocated slots to other airlines. While the Civil Aviation Secretary states operations are almost back to normal, IndiGo has processed significant refunds and assisted stranded customers.

items.title: Why stock market fell today? Sensex slumps 436 pts, Nifty below 25,850; 5 key factors behind the decline
items.summary: Indian stocks ended lower on Tuesday, with both the Sensex and Nifty extending their previous day's significant decline. Investors remained cautious, anticipating the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision and ongoing uncertainty surrounding a U.S. trade agreement. This cautious sentiment followed their steepest drop in over two months.

items.title: India's record-low battery storage bids raise concerns over project viability
items.summary: A significant challenge arises in India’s renewable energy journey with battery storage project bids reaching unprecedented lows. Industry experts express concern that such low bid prices may lead to unsafe and impractical projects, potentially hindering the country's ambitious renewable energy timeline.

items.title: GMR Airports plans about $245 million long-term bond sale: Sources
items.summary: GMR Airports is preparing to issue its longest-ever 15-year bonds, aiming to raise approximately 22 billion rupees ($245 million) by month-end. The funds will be utilized to refinance debt for GMR Hyderabad International and for general corporate needs. This move aligns with the company's strategy to replace expensive foreign-currency borrowings with cheaper local debt.

items.title: Aviation Ministry deploys senior officers for on-ground inspection at 10 major airports amid IndiGo crisis
items.summary: Senior officials are inspecting major Indian airports. This follows widespread disruptions caused by IndiGo's operational issues. The Ministry of Civil Aviation and DGCA are monitoring the situation closely. Officers will assess passenger difficulties and airline operations. Any identified shortcomings will be addressed immediately. IndiGo's internal planning is cited as the cause of problems.

items.title: HCL Technologies shares in focus after strategic pact to co-develop energy-efficient chips
items.summary: HCL Technologies said it has entered a strategic partnership with France-based Dolphin Semiconductor to co-develop energy-efficient chips. The collaboration will integrate Dolphin’s low-power semiconductor IP into HCLTech’s silicon design workflows to build high-efficiency system-on-chip solutions. HCLTech executives said the move aligns with rising demand for sustainable, high-performance computing as AI workloads expand. Dolphin Semiconductor said the partnership will extend the reach of its low-power technology across applications from IoT devices to data-centre ecosystems.

items.title: India’s aviation crisis is all about too big to tame
items.summary: Recent flight cancellations by IndiGo have exposed India's aviation market issues. Leaving a large market to one airline created problems. Stricter pilot rules caused crew shortages. Authorities rolled back rules, but the incident damaged India's image. Competition is needed to protect consumers and the country's reputation.

items.summary: IndiGo faces stern warnings from the Civil Aviation Minister. The airline cancelled over 5,000 flights recently. This disrupted travel for nearly 600,000 passengers. items.summary: India's farm sector is projected to grow 4% in 2025-26. NITI Aayog member Ramesh Chand stated higher growth is crucial for achieving 'Viksit Bharat' by 2042. Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan highlighted balanced fertilizer use and integrated farming for small landholders. These efforts aim to ensure soil health and future prosperity.

items.title: Thali becomes cheaper in Nov on lower pulses & veggie prices: Crisil
items.summary: Home-cooked thali costs dropped significantly in November. Vegetarian and non-vegetarian thalis saw a 13% year-on-year decrease. This was driven by falling prices for vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. Broiler prices also contributed to the decline in non-veg thali costs. Pulses became cheaper due to increased stocks and imports.

items.title: IIFCL's $500-m ECB oversubscribed five times, at lowest cost
items.summary: India Infrastructure Finance Co. Ltd. successfully raised $500 million through external commercial borrowing. The borrowing was oversubscribed five times, securing funds at the lowest cost for a 15-year term. This move strengthens IIFCL's capacity to finance crucial infrastructure projects across India.

items.title: APAC likely to stay resilient to US tariffs, China slowdown: Fitch
items.summary: Most Asia-Pacific nations will likely withstand US tariffs and China's economic slowdown. India faces higher tariffs as it lacks a trade deal with Washington. Strong external accounts and central bank actions will help manage weaker exports. Fiscal deficits are expected to remain high across the region, with slow improvement anticipated.

items.title: After IndiGo crisis, railways loco pilots seek work-hour cap
items.summary: Indian Railways loco pilots are demanding duty hour limits to combat fatigue and prevent accidents. They point to the recent crisis at IndiGo concerning pilot rest hours. The loco pilots' association criticizes the government's approach, contrasting it with how private corporations are treated.

items.title: IndiGo top officials seek time to reply to regulator's notice
items.summary: IndiGo Airlines has sought additional time from the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) to clarify the significant flight cancellations plaguing the summer schedule. The airline attributes the disruptions to intricate operational issues and the substantial scale of their services. As a result, they are trimming their flight timetable.

items.title: General insurers log a premium November
items.summary: India's general insurance sector experienced robust growth in November. Gross direct premium income surged by 24 percent year-on-year. This expansion was fueled by increased motor sales and a rebound in retail health insurance demand. Standalone health insurers and private multi-line insurers showed significant gains, outpacing public sector competitors.

items.title: IiAS raises concerns over oversight, culture at IndiGo
items.summary: A proxy advisory firm has raised concerns about InterGlobe Aviation's board. The firm criticizes the company's approach to customer satisfaction and regulatory compliance. It suggests the board failed in risk and stakeholder management. The firm believes leadership should have acted sooner. The regulator may need to step in if the board does not.

items.title: City gas firms race ahead on CNG, lag on home connections
items.summary: In a booming trend, Indian city gas companies are swiftly increasing the number of CNG stations, surpassing their initial targets. Yet, there remains a gap in household piped-gas connections, largely due to the straightforward nature of establishing CNG outlets compared to the intricate, labor-intensive process needed for household pipeline installations.

items.title: Slimmer price tag helps Wegovy sales gain weight
items.summary: Novo Nordisk has slashed Wegovy prices in India by nearly 40 percent. This move has dramatically increased sales volume by 70 percent in November. The drug's market share also rose to 14 percent. This price reduction aims to compete with rival Mounjaro. Another Novo Nordisk drug, Ozempic, is expected to launch soon, potentially further impacting prices.

items.title: Respiratory drug sales peak in November amid worsening AQI
items.summary: India's air quality decline is boosting medicines for breathing problems. The respiratory drug market grew 8% last month, a rise from previous years. This trend highlights a strong link between pollution and illness. States like Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand saw significant sales increases for asthma and COPD treatments. Antihistamine use also climbed.

items.title: Motown hits a bump on slowing two-wheeler sales
items.summary: Scooters and bikes account for three-fourths of all vehicles sold in the country. Last month, a decline in sales in the segment pulled the overall industry's growth down to 2% despite robust performances by cars (20%), commercial vehicles (20%) and tractors (57%).

items.title: Starlink takes down India plan priced at Rs 8,600 per month
items.summary: Early Monday, Starlink displayed residential plans in India at ₹8,600 per month (about $95) - roughly 20% cheaper than its US offering but almost double the price in markets like Brazil and Indonesia. The hardware terminal was listed at ₹34,000 ($377). By evening, both figures had disappeared from the site.

items.title: High-value parts push up electronics firms' import bill

The sole exception was in FY24 with a 6% decline in the consolidated import bill of these companies.

items.title: India Budget Basics: If the calculations puzzle you, this is how the budget maths really works

Crude oil prices also significantly influence budget allocations, especially for subsidies. Realistic projections are crucial for budget credibility.

items.title: Pixel launch: Is Google Assistant's AI an assault on privacy?
items.summary: Sure, artificial intelligence can make life simpler by suggesting you places to eat, tell you weather, or even crack a joke.  The more you use it, the more it learns about your habits and preferences. The protocols pertaining to artificial intelligence, or the lack of it, make our data less secure and more vulnerable.

items.title: Up over 200% in 1 year, what's buzzing with Borosil Glass?
items.summary: Shares of Borosil Glass Works have increased threefold over the past one year as the company has posted strong revenue and EBIDTA growth over the past few quarters.

items.title: Why you should not be always chasing returns
items.summary: Most people focus on returns and chase products that offer the best returns at any point.

items.title: Jhunjhunwala-partnered fund buys stake in TFCI: What's buzzing?
items.summary: In an interview with CNBC-TV18, Satpal Arora, MD of Tourism Finance Corporation of India (TFCI), talked about the state of business and the outlook ahead.

items.title: RBI latest meeting 'diluted' its old policy framework: Nomura
items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
